content:
check_equalities finds occurrences of @Eq X x y in the goal, runs inferType on x and y, and reports any discrepancies at reducible transparency between those types and X.

This can be useful for diagnosing defeq problems.

Future work:

  • use the Expr-diff machinery to highlight differences (if anyone would like to implement this, that would be great!)
  • we could just do this for all function applications, not just Eq, but this would require more thought about presenting the results
I'll see if I can find some time for the second bullet point

Eric Wieser said:

Should diagnostic tactics start with #?

I think I tried that, but somewhere the parser was unhappy... If anyone wants to try this I would be happy to see that in a subsequent PR.

For now, the fact that the unused_tactics linter flags check_equalities if it doesn't find any discrepancy is hopefully enough.
